items.title: New Release?
items.body: There hasn't been a release for a while - it'd be great to have an official release that contained https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest-metadata/pull/18

items.title: Accept Metadata as JSON String
items.body:
Hi!

Thanks for this great project!

Would the maintainers be interested in supporting an additional command line arg to support metadata being passed in as a JSON string? Something like:
```--metadata-json '{"cat_says": "meow"}'```?

My team and I have a use case where we have lots of metadata to pass in and want to avoid dozens of ```--metadata``` args.

I'm happy to submit a PR if so.

Thanks!

items.title: node.slaveoutput has no key 'metadata' when used with xdist
items.body:
I ran into the following problem while using pytest with xdist. It seems the key 'metadata' sometimes does not exist in node.slaveoutput. My purposed solution is to add a check for key before trying to access it. I am still in middle of looking for other possible solutions, but thought I should put make this issue so that its in your attention.

items.title: [feature request] Be able to add metadata with OOP structure of tests(Class based).
Suppressing metadata dump in the terminal report
items.body:
I'm using pytest-metadata in a [plugin to create JSON reports](https://github.com/numirias/pytest-json-report/), similar to how pytest-html uses it, and someone asked for an option to suppress the metadata [dump in the terminal report](https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest-metadata/blob/1363d9680c583d54d9a87b5d9fa5f48542f66a6c/pytest_metadata/plugin.py#L73).

Would an option for that be possible? Personally, I'd even favor an opt-in (or a configurable length limit) because any plugin which has pytest-metadata as a dependency, and potentially adds new objects with a large repr string to it, will unconditionally write all metadata to the terminal, even if not intended.

items.title: ImportError: No module named _pluggy when updating to pytest 3.3.0
items.body:

items.title: Allow metadata to be passed on the command line
items.body: It would be useful to allow simple metadata to be added via the command line. For example, `pytest --metadata foo bar` would result in `metadata['foo']` having the value `'bar'`. This would be limited to simple strings, and nothing more complex.
